data.title: German Movies and Actors Online Trivia
data.meta_description: This is about some movies, actors and actresses from my native country. Even we have some to remember. Take my quiz and find out if youve heard of them, too.
data.text:
Quiz Answer Key and Fun Facts

1. Easy one to start with: This movie - starring Franka Potente and Moritz Bleibtreu - also was in theatres in the U.S. It's about time, the possibilities in life, and getting a second chance... and it's really FAST. Do you know its title?

Answer: 'Lola rennt'

The American title was 'Run Lola Run' (the German title would be translated as 'Lola is Running'). The writer and director was Tom Tykwer ('Heaven' with Cate Blanchett and Giovanni Ribisi), probably our greatest directing genius right now (according to critics, reviews and also my personal opinion). 'Winterschlaefer' and 'Der Krieger und die Kaiserin' (also starring Franka) were directed by Tykwer, too. 'Anatomie' also starred Franka, but it isn't one of Tykwer's movies.

2. After 'American Pie' was released in Germany, our filmmakers quickly reacted to it. Do you know the German answer to 'American Pie''?

Answer: 'Harte Jungs'

'Harte Jungs' ('Tough Boys') was the first German movie that dealt with topics similar to 'American Pie'. It is about 16-year-old Florian who wakes up one morning and finds his male organ talking to him... what follows is a movie that is so stupid that you can't help loving it.

After 'Harte Jungs', there were more movies to come like 'Maedchen, Maedchen' ('Girls, Girls'), 'Schule' ('School') or, recently, 'Knallharte Jungs', the sequel to 'Harte Jungs'.

3. In 2001, a movie was released that turned out to be the most successful German movie since there are statistics. In theatres from July '01 until February '02 (in the big cities even longer), more than 10.000.000 spectators... It was a movie by Michael 'Bully' Herbig, a German {comedian;} a parody on 'Winnetou'. Do you know the title?

Answer: 'Der Schuh des Manitu'

Would be translated as 'The Shoe of Manitu'. It is about Abahachi - chieftain of the Apaches - and his blood brother Ranger. Abahachi wanted to buy a pub for his tribe, so he borrowed gold from the tribe of the Chochones. But the businessman Santa Maria - who sold Abahachi the building - betrays him, steals the gold and shoots the son of the Chochones' chieftain and then blames Abahachi and Ranger.

This is why the Chochones want to unbury the hatchet... the only problem: they don't have a hatchet anymore! So they look for something else to dig out, and they find it: They unbury the folding-chair! So now Abahachi and Ranger get into trouble...

4. This German actor is very well-known for his role of 'Schimanski' in the TV series of the same name. Furthermore, he played two (!) German serial killers in the movies 'Der Totmacher' and 'Der Sandmann', and he starred in the satire 'Schtonk!' - among hundreds of other movies. Do you know his name?

Answer: Goetz George

Goetz George is one of the highest-rated actors here in Germany.

5. This German-Hungarian co-production deals with a lover's triangle before World War II. The protagonist is a Hungarian composer who writes a song for the woman he loves. And this song (which really exists!) turns out to rule their faith. Which song?

Answer: 'Gloomy Sunday'

'Gloomy Sunday' ('Szomoru Vasarnap') was composed by the Hungarian musician Reszo Seress in 1962 (lyrics by Laszlo Javor, English lyrics by Sam Lewis). This song became famous for causing a lot of suicides (more than 200!) - it is said that Seress found such an impressive way of putting his own sadness into the melody that the song brings up all the depressions inside the listeners... kind of eerie.

There are countless records of the song, among others by Elvis Costello, Heather Nova, Marianne Faithful (all for the movie soundtrack), Sarah Brightman, Freddy Quinn and Billie Holliday (the first English record).

The movie was subtitled 'Ein Lied von Liebe und Tod' ('A Song of Love and Death').

6. After 'Scream' - as we all know - a wave of teen horror movies followed, and also our German filmmakers couldn't resist. The first German horror movie after 'Scream' was...?

Answer: 'Flashback - Moerderische Ferien'

'Flashback' - which isn't as bad as everyone first thought - deals with a young woman whose parents were murdered when she was a child. She survived. Now, 20 years later, she takes a job as a private French teacher, and soon, there are more murders to come... 'Anatomie' with Franka Potente deal with murders at the University of {Heidelberg;} 'Schrei - denn ich werde dich toeten' ('Scream - because I'm gonna kill you') was a TV movie which was basically the same as {'Scream';} and 'Schrei wenn du kannst' ('Scream if you can') was the German title of 'Valentine', starring Marley Shelton and David 'Angel' Boreanaz.

7. This German actress is well-known from screen, stage, and TV. She starred in movies like 'Bandits', 'Der bewegte Mann', 'Die Apothekerin' and 'Nur ueber meine Leiche', and she recently played in a theatre production in Berlin, 'Raucher-Nichtraucher'. Do you know her name?

Answer: Katja Riemann

She was in 'Comedian Harmonists', too.

8. You might know this German-Italian actor from the 'Winnetou' movies where he played Santer. Who is he?

Answer: Mario Adorf

Mario used to play the villains, but meanwhile, he plays everything (and -one). He was in Michael Ende's 'Momo' as well as in the German remake of 'Little Lord Fauntleroy' ('Der kleine Lord'), playing Alec Guinness's role.

9. This actor is a legend, and his movies are immortal. He mostly starred in comedies. The most famous one is 'Die Feuerzangenbowle' about a writer who decides to go back to school. Other movies include 'Der Mustergatte' and 'Auf den Spuren von Sherlock Holmes'. Do you know this actor, too?

Answer: Heinz Ruehmann

He died in 1994.

10. This movie is about the 'first German boygroup'. It takes place in the 1930s and deals with the story of six men who form an a cappella group. This group becomes very famous, but since there are Jews in it, they have to break up when the anti-semitism starts to rule in Germany. Their greatest hits include 'Mein kleiner gruener Kaktus', 'Veronika der Lenz ist da' and 'Wochenend und Sonnenschein'. What is the name of the group (and the movie)?

Answer: Comedian Harmonists

The movie was very successful. It starred Max Tidof, Ben Becker, Heino Ferch, Kai Wiesinger, Heinrich Schafmeister and Ulrich Noethen as the {singers;} the director was Joseph Vilsmaier.

Source: Author PearlQ19

This quiz was reviewed by FunTrivia editor rj211 before going online.

Any errors found in FunTrivia content are routinely corrected through our feedback system.
